meanings.definition: A person who is skilled in the art of arranging or classifying.
meanings.sent1: The taxites organized the books by genre in the library.
meanings.sent2: The taxites at the museum carefully arranged the artifacts by time period.
meanings.sent3: The taxites decided to sort the candies by color for fun.
meanings.sent4: She was a taxites of emotions, neatly categorizing each feeling in her journal.
meanings.sent5: The taxites' ability to sort shapes by size amazed everyone.

meanings.definition: A group of organisms that are classified together based on shared characteristics.
meanings.sent1: The taxites of birds in the forest included robins, sparrows, and blue jays.
meanings.sent2: The taxites of flowers in the garden consisted of roses, daisies, and tulips.
meanings.sent3: The taxites of fruits at the market made the apple and orange argue about their similarities.
meanings.sent4: The taxites of stars in the sky formed beautiful constellations.
meanings.sent5: The taxites of cars in the parking lot ranged from sedans to SUVs.

meanings.definition: To arrange or classify according to a system or principle.
meanings.sent1: She decided to taxites her wardrobe by color to make it easier to find clothes.
meanings.sent2: The librarian will taxites the new books onto the shelves alphabetically.
meanings.sent3: He tried to taxites his thoughts before the important presentation.
meanings.sent4: The teacher will taxites the students into groups for the group project.
meanings.sent5: The chef will taxites the ingredients before starting to cook the meal.
